benchmark_details.name: PEOPLE JOIN
benchmark_details.overview: PEOPLE JOIN is a benchmark for evaluating LM-mediated collaborative problem solving. It comprises two evaluation domains: PEOPLE JOIN-QA, which focuses on questions about tabular data, and PEOPLE JOIN-DOCCREATION, which addresses document creation tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of PEOPLE JOIN is to evaluate the effectiveness of LLM-powered agents in facilitating collaborative information gathering tasks.

data.source: The PEOPLE JOIN benchmark consists of synthetic organizations with users, where each user has distinct access to documents crucial for solving collaborative tasks.
data.size: 500 test tasks for PEOPLE JOIN-QA, 200 test instances for PEOPLE JOIN-DOCCREATION

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on the comparison of agent responses to ground-truth answers and reference summaries.
methodology.interpretation: Metrics indicate the effectiveness of agents in coordinating information gathering and producing accurate responses.
methodology.baseline_results: The max accuracy score achievable is 54.8 in PEOPLE JOIN-QA with gpt-4-turbo.
methodology.validation: Evaluations are conducted using LM agent implementations and include metrics for both correctness and efficiency.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Privacy risks emerge when agents access personal documents.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: SPIDER dataset is available under CC BY-SA 4.0 license.
